io.openmessaging.routing

Interface Routing


  • public interface Routing
    A Routing object is responsible for routing the messages from Topic to Queue, with some useful operators to filter or compute the source messages.
    Since:
    OMS 1.0
    Version:
    OMS 1.0
    Author:
    vintagewang@apache.org, yukon@apache.org

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Routing addOperator(Operator op)
      Adds a Operator to the tail of operator pipeline in this Routing object.
      Routing deleteOperator(Operator op)
      Removes a specified Operator from the operator pipeline in this Routing object.
      List<Operator> operators()
      Returns the operator pipeline in this Routing object.
      KeyValue properties()
      Returns the attributes of this Routing instance.

    • Method Detail

      • properties

        KeyValue properties()
        Returns the attributes of this Routing instance. Changes to the return KeyValue are not reflected in physical Routing, and use ResourceManager.createAndUpdateRouting(String, KeyValue) to modify.

        There are some standard attributes defined by OMS for Routing:

        • OMSBuiltinKeys.SRC_TOPIC, the source topic of this Routing object.
        • OMSBuiltinKeys.DST_QUEUE, the destination queue of this Routing object.
        • OMSBuiltinKeys.ROUTING_NAME, the unique name of this Routing object.
        Returns:
        the attributes

      • addOperator

        Routing addOperator(Operator op)
        Adds a Operator to the tail of operator pipeline in this Routing object.
        Parameters:
        op - a specified operator
        Returns:
        this Routing object

      • deleteOperator

        Routing deleteOperator(Operator op)
        Removes a specified Operator from the operator pipeline in this Routing object.
        Parameters:
        op - a specified operator
        Returns:
        this Routing object

      • operators

        List<Operator> operators()
        Returns the operator pipeline in this Routing object.
        Returns:
        the operator pipeline
